transcripts.text: But when we see the hearing yesterday, a lot of questions about impeachment.  You talk about three distinct things there, bribery, abuse of power, things that could go into articles of impeachment.  Why would the public not think that the House is dead set on a course to impeach the president when all of this milieu is going on?

Well, all this milieu is a seeking of the truth.  It's called an inquiry.  And if the president has something that is exculpatory, Mr.  President, that means you have anything that shows your innocence, then he should make that known.  And that's part of the inquiry.  And so far, we haven't seen that, but we welcome it.  And that's what an inquiry is.
